page.title: 17TOTTINGTON LIBRARY
page.content: The building dates from the 17th Century.In 1715 it was a mansion owned by Thomas Nuttall.In 1918 Tottington Council bought it and made it into the Town Hall until 1974.There are 9285 books altogether borrowed at a rate of 640 a week.There are three staff, one works both in Ramsbottom and Tottington.The building was in very poor condition, and repair work started on 14:1:1985, and is due to finish by September 1985.It would be used as a library on the ground floor and meeting rooms on the first. When it is finished it will cost Â£123 000. There are 8 to 10 tradesmen working daily on the site.They work 39 hours a week and rarely get overtime.The most expensive jobs are heating, electrical work and joinery.
